channel.title: Portal Help
channel.description: how do i make so you got to get permison to enter a portal (for a quest) and when you have completed it you can not go though it no more?

@SirPali wrote:

The program just shows where your errors are. Follow it’s instruction to where the errors are, and fix 'em

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

-Rage-Pk:

Yes, so if you do < below the end stage of the quest that means you can go through anytime until the quest stage is above the number. E.g if the quest stage goes above the number that means the quest is complete anyway.

Yah, but that would also mean you can go through the portal without starting the quest. If your questprogress is 0, its also below the progress needed to complete the quest. I don’t think that’s supposed to happen hmm?

@de dust89:

I’m using Eclipse, but I saw your mistake when I just read the code Methods never use a ; in the header

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:7, topic:330050”][quote author=de dust89 link=topic=426436.msg3132150#msg3132150 date=1266601640]
kinda made this off the top of my head… go head and test it out though =)

[code]
public void questPortal();

if(q## == 3) && (objectID == ####) {
p.toX = xcoords;
p.toY = ycoords;
} else {
q## = 1;
sM(“You have to have completed the quest to teleport here.”);
}[/code]
[/quote]

That should be:

[code=java]
public void questPortal(){

if(q## == 3) && (objectID == ####) {
p.toX = xcoords;
p.toY = ycoords;
} else {
q## = 1;
sM(“You have to have completed the quest to teleport here.”);
}
}[/code]

Anyway, this would also work, but it’s easier to just add it in case 132, as that is the case handling what happens when you click on an object ;).

@Rage
No… Read it again.

and when you have completed it you can not go though it no more[/quote]

Oh, forgot that top bracket =o Anyways, you using Netbeans or Eclipse IDE?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

[quote=“de dust89, post:5, topic:330050”]kinda made this off the top of my head… go head and test it out though =)

[code]
public void questPortal();

if(q## == 3) && (objectID == ####) {
p.toX = xcoords;
p.toY = ycoords;
} else {
q## = 1;
sM(“You have to have completed the quest to teleport here.”);
}[/code][/quote]

That should be:

[code=java]
public void questPortal(){

if(q## == 3) && (objectID == ####) {
p.toX = xcoords;
p.toY = ycoords;
} else {
q## = 1;
sM(“You have to have completed the quest to teleport here.”);
}
}[/code]

Anyway, this would also work, but it’s easier to just add it in case 132, as that is the case handling what happens when you click on an object ;).

@Rage
No… Read it again.

and when you have completed it you can [b]not[/b] go though it no more

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @Rage-Pk -Rage-Pk
item.description:
@Rage-Pk wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:4, topic:330050”]@Rage
Well no. That would mean you could go through when you are not supposed to.

Example:
If you would do questprogress < 15, you could go through the portal when your questprogress is still at 0.

It’s better to just be able to go through the portal at a certain point in the quest, and when you’ve used the portal, increase the questprogress by 1 so you could not go through the portal anymore.[/quote]

yeah he wants you to not be able to go through once you’ve completed it only.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

kinda made this off the top of my head… go head and test it out though =)

[code]
public void questPortal();

if(q## == 3 && objectID == ####) {//REPLACE ALL ### WITH COORDS, OR QUEST NUMBER…OR IDS… ECT.
p.toX = xcoords;
p.toY = ycoords;
} else {
q## = 1;
sM(“You have to have completed the quest to teleport here.”);
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

@Rage
Well no. That would mean you could go through when you are not supposed to.

Example:
If you would do questprogress < 15, you could go through the portal when your questprogress is still at 0.

It’s better to just be able to go through the portal at a certain point in the quest, and when you’ve used the portal, increase the questprogress by 1 so you could not go through the portal anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @Rage-Pk -Rage-Pk
item.description:
@Rage-Pk wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:2, topic:330050”]In client.java, search for

case 132:

This case handles the clicking on items.
In it, add something like this:

[code=java]
if (objectID == IdOfPortal)
{
if (questprogress == yourquestrequirement)
{
toX = #####;
toY = #####; // Coords of teleport place here
}else{
sendMessage(“You cannot go through this portal”);

		}

}[/code][/quote]

would it not be easier to put if questprogress < end quest stage, e.g 15 if thats when he’s compeleted / it goes green

teleport
teleport
sendmessage

else

sendmessage you cannot use this portal no more

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Help
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

In client.java, search for

case 132:

This case handles the clicking on items.
In it, add something like this:

[code=java]
if (objectID == IdOfPortal)
{
if (questprogress == yourquestrequirement)
{
toX = #####;
toY = #####; // Coords of teleport place here
}else{
sendMessage(“You cannot go through this portal”);

		}

}[/code]

Read full topic
